Reviews.Title: “First visit but we trust it will not be our last................”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: ................travelling from Liverpool, my wife and I (both aged 70+) spent three nights in mid April 2012. We were completely satisfied with the rooms and facilities. The breakfast was splendid and we enjoyed two first class dinners in the "Via del Sol". The staff were always efficient and friendly. A minor criticism, the dining room was clearly under-staffed. We would reccommend the Ivbergs Premium to any potential visitor and are eager to return a.s.a.p. David and Barbara Radcliffe (Southport)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPCManchester
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would definitely recommend it - very friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are very clean and spacious - only downside being no tea/coffee making facilities. We had breakfast included in our deal which was fantastic, so much choice! The location is also very good, so easy to get around with the u/s bahn close by (the hotel is located in between Nollendorf and Witternberg stations). Nice little square next to Wittenberg station with market stalls and restaurants around and there's also the KaDeWe shopping complex Loved Berlin and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Rills
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this place which we paid £45 a night for via Groupon. The location is great and in easy walking distance of the underground, Ka de We (a vast department store) and several lovely places to eat and drink. Breakfast was prolific and of a really good quality. Definitely a hotel for suitable for sight seeing or perhaps business travellers. As we were doing the former and it was perfect for us! There is so much to do in Berlin we literally only slept and ate breakfast in the hotel. If you want a romantic get away with posh hotel rooms and all the glitz that go with that then maybe this isn't quite the place for you. But if yo are looking for a good, clean, well located, efficient run hotel this is the one for you! I would go back again tomorrow! PS You only get one pillow each in the room but ask at reception and they will happily supply you with a second.

Reviews.Title: “To stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dura59
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel.Rooms are big and clean.Breakfast is good.The staff is very good.If you go to berlin.Stay in this hotel.The center of the city's many Pediatrics

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anat O
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Berlin. We arrived to the hotel and the greeted very nice. the room was great, clean, neat. Breakfast was great as well. The location was great - next to 2 train stations and 5 minutes walk from the KaDeWe shopping mall. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Best City Hotel...A*”
Reviews.Author: cuba07Staffordshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, after reading the reviews.The hotel is top quality for the price.Hotel so clean, staff so polite/helpful.Breakfast is 15 euros each but we got it included with deal so glad we did, best city breakfast ive ever had...eggs,bacon, homemade sausage , fresh fruit, cereals , yogurts, breads, salami, smoke salmon, cakes etc Rooms are lovely , bathroom design suited us, 2 showers in cubicle high & low.Free safe in room.Mini bar in room but we didnot use it brought from Lidl and took to room before going out for evening meal. Best way from Schonfield Airport is buy a welcome card if you intend to travel around the city this allows you to travel the trains, underground, and trams for free after purchase.It cost 26 euros each and last 72 hours from the first journery you use.(just stamp it at machine at train station first, machine on platform)Walk out Airport turn left walk for 2 mins then cross road you will see Train station.Catch the train for Zoogarten called Airport Express ( one of the main train station) this takes about 35-40 mins tops.Then get underground ( which is just outside train station look for burger king and you will see entrance to UB) catch to wittenbourg which is one stop and come out of station and the hotel in on same street just look for Lidl sign to head in right direction , hotel is just before Lidl.(about 5 mins walk from station) within one hour from gettting of plane we were check in and walking to nearest German bar.You can get Ub to Nordenplatz which is 2 stops then turn right out of station and follow again to Lidl then hotel is just after. (hotel is in middle of both stations) Lidl is open from 8am till 10pm and supermarket just around corner called Kaisers which advertised from 7 am till 24 hr.Both very cheap bottle of dry white wine 2 euros, bottle of vodka 4-5 euros...If you looking for small tradional german bar with good food walk to nordenplatz station stay on hotel side, end of street turn left around corner walk for about 3 mins cross over road by traffic lights and you will see it on corner with chairs outside its called something A, I love german food and this is very tradional for about 7-13 euros a main.If you after a small tradional german bar turn left out of hotel cross road at first lights walk down this street for mins, look for benches outside , its very tradional and friendly barman and locals and VERY CHEAP three large beers, two vodka-tonic, and a german herbal shot come to 13 euros.Slumberland is a carribean bar about 10 mins walk form hotel, with sand on floor would recommend this, walk to Nordenplatz station turn right there cross road walk past lots of bars, restaurants to first lights and its on right side on corner, you can also smoke inside if you want to.We went on open top bus paid 16 euros each which was discounted because of havine Welcome card should be 22 euros.This allows you to travel city and stops 22 stops bus every 15 mins.We have always use them in every city but this one was a little disapointed only because there is so much traffic lights and the journery takes a while to get around, but we still glad we got one.Ka de we the big department store is 5 mins from hotel, is like Harrods worth a visit. Olympic statium is about 15 mins on underground from hotel well worth a visit cost 5 euros to enter stadium this allow discounte from welcome card, just get UB to something like Rubern and get off at stop called Olympic statium turn left at station walk under subway for 800 meters then there. I could go on and on , so much to see and do but you will not be dissapointed with hotel.Congralations to all staff for your hard work and kindness. Well Done...

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but not the 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: 4Sandt
Reviews.Content: The room was a little small, but extremely well presented and clean. The shower was something to long for after a packed day of Berlin's sights. The location is convenient for shopping and the all important U2 (orange) line which takes you to the main sights, museum island, brandenburg, etc. The staff, especially ginger (as he was known) were ideal, friendly and accommodating. One area not comfortable was the toilet tissue, which needs an upgrade. Also the little amenities you would expect from a 4star were missing. The Wi-fi needs upgrading as we got zero signal in the room which we later found out is only available in the lobby. Internet in room is only via a network cable. This is not very clear when booking, and isn't convenient with most of us on tabs, phones, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the City”
Reviews.Author: stacyjo91
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night break to this hotel with my friend (we are aged 19 and 20). Still can't quite believe how we managed to get such a cheap deal - £100pp for flights, 2 nights and breakfast included, when the breakfast was being advertised at the hotel at 15 euros per person per day! We were pleasantly surprised with the rooms that, although a bit small, had everything you need and were very modern. The bathroom is compact but has an amazing shower that makes you feel like you are in a much more expensive hotel! Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the guy on reception (didn't get his name). Our departing flight wasn't until 9.40pm but the hotel were absolutely fine with us keeping our luggage in their storage facility behind reception. Location was good, although if you want something more central probably best going with a hotel located in the Mitte district but for the price we paid you really can't fault it. There are 2 U-Bahn (underground) stations within easy reach; we used Nollendorfplatz but Wittenburgplatz was a little further up in the other direction. Some good restaurants if you turn right out of the hotel and walk up towards the KaDeWe department store - we found most food to be reasonably priced and we even ate in the Hotel restaurant which was good value for money with good service. I think there were even set menus which were a good price too. We were surprised that there was free internet in the hotel - every other hotel I've been to you have to pay 1 euro or something so this was a definite plus. Berlin is an interesting city but prepared to walk quite a bit. Everything is quite spaced out and we found it hard to get used to finding places as there's no real 'touristy' areas but once we got the hang of the U-Bahn system and which areas had the key places to visit we were absolutely fine. We purchased a Welcome Card at the airport which entitled us to money off attractions (only actually used it once to get 2 euros off the Panoramapunkt tower) but if you are planning to visit lots of museums etc. would be well worth it. Interestingly, Berlin's underground does not have ticket gates say like London and so you could travel for free on it. Although, perhaps not advised as I read that ticket inspectors do travel on there and can fine you 40 euros...although we never encountered or saw one... Overall, I would recommend this hotel for small groups or couples. Perhaps not for stag or hen dos as the hotel is quite sophisticated and quiet although there were some German coach parties that turned up on our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: iluvholidaysHull_UK
Reviews.Content: My hubby & i have just returned from a 3-night stay at this fabulous hotel, and it more than lived up to our expectations. Immaculately clean, comfy beds, huge walk-in shower (I want one at home!!), wonderful buffet breakfast, helpful & friendly staff, and perfectly situated for exploring this fascinating city. We used both the Wittenburg Platz & Nollendorf Platz U-Bahn stations, both equal distance from hotel but we preferred the Nollendorf one for ease of access. Bought a 3-day Welcome Card from the hotel, just under 24 euros each, and used it for all out travel, plus reduced entry to various museums, ones we had actually planned to visit anyway. As previous reviewers have stated, the lack of tea & coffeee making facilities in the rooms are the only negative point but we managed & it wouldn't discourage us from booking there again. We had a room on the first floor overlooking the main road, absoulutely fine, albeit a bit noisy if you wish to have your window open. Would probably ask for a room at the rear if we came again as we do love to sleep with the window slightly open. We got an excellent deal booking the hotel through Low Cost Holidays, I'd researched all the usual booking companies but this one came up tops again, by quite a substantial sum. All in all, highly recommended hotel, book it now, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnnydontdoit
Reviews.Content: All you can ask from a hotel, room small but adequate, all fitting nicely finished, separate shower, separate toilet, TV sky news, no tea/coffee making facilities in room though, Free safe, hotel has free internet in room by reception. Staff very pleasant, breakfast is 15 euro's if you are paying but the quality of the food is fantastic. Fresh orange juice, hot food is scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, mushrooms continental food also from ham's to cheese's to smoked salmon. Hotel Well placed in the city next to the main shopping area. If I was returning to Berlin would stay here again. Asked for a room on top floor at the back of the hotel and there was no noise at all. Had a set 3 course meal in the hotel and paid 31 euro's for two people with a beer and soft drink. Good value as again the quality and amount of food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evans33
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a wonderful 3 nights at this hotel, the staff are extremely helpful, the food is excellent, and a great location. Could not have stayed in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jon365athen
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a City break in Berlin, during which we stayed at the Ivbergs Premium hotel. The hotel is well situated (central location), and only a short walk from U Bahn station ''Nollendorf platz'' on the U2 line. A Lidl supermarket is also situated close to the hotel (Ideal for purchasing bottled water etc). Upon arrival at the Ivbergs premium, we were greeted by a friendly (English speaking) receptionist who checked us in quickly & efficiently and issued us with our key card for us room. First impressions of the hotel are excellent as the reception is clean, modern and very contemporary. We had a Twin room that was clean, had comfortable beds, a TV (with a few English channel's) and En-suit bathroom (shower only). The shower was very impressive & the hotel provide you with mini complimentary shower gel, shampoo and a bar of soap. We slept well during our stay with no disruptions. Our room faced the main road, however once the window's were closed you could here no traffic noise! One thing that would of been nice is Tea & Coffee making facilities in our room. However the hotel does have a bar on the ground floor and in your room is a 10% discount voucher for the hotel's bar (nice touch). Other facilities our room had included: - A safe (free of charge) we thought this was excellent as most hotel's I've stayed in have charged guests for use of the safe! - Hair dryer - Make up mirror - Free Wifi (obtain code from Reception) - Telephone - Room service (didn't use) - Mini bar (didn't use) They is also a fridge in your room, However inside the fridge is the Mini-bar - we removed a few bottle's from it so we could store out bottled water in there. (Just remember to put the bottles back when you checkout, so the hotel know if you have used the mini-bar) Breakfast at the Ivbergs was excellent (one of the best). You could choose from a traditional continental Breakfast - croissants, rolls, pastries, breads, jam and marmalade. Or a cooked breakfast (bacon, eggs etc) They was also cold meats, cheeses and breakfast biscuits available too. To drink you could have tea (many different types of tea were offered), coffee or juice (Orange, multivitamin to name a few of the juices). Breakfast is presented as a help yourself buffet. Personally, I was very impressed with the Ivbergs Premium hotel and would certainly recommend, due to it's superb staff, Location, Cleanliness throughout, modern contemporary build, comfortable beds, value for money and great facilities. The hotel's Market seemed to be both business and pleasure (So I felt very welcome here on a city break in Berlin). The hotel's location on Googlemaps is very accurate (However, you cannot see the hotel on street view as it's a new hotel) Upon leaving Nollendorf platz station look for the Lidl supermarket and the hotel is a 1 minute walk past there on the right hand side. Walking time from the U bahn station to the hotel is around 3 minutes. I booked the hotel via Travelrepublic.co.uk and paid only £85 (Yes! £85 complete and final cost for 2 adults, 2 nights in one twin room with breakfast included!) Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel overall!”
Reviews.Author: Sotiris_Ath_GR
Reviews.Content: Ivbergs premium hotel is a very nice hotel and We were lucky enough to have it at a good price, although the price is different if you book it from one internet site or another and in many cases it includes breakfast (which is more than great!). The location is very convenient between two metro stops. I would definately recommend it. The little bar at the lobby is nice and convenient but the room service is a bit slow and not so effective! Another minus in this great hotel's evaluation is that the front desk staff- although polite- was a bit cold. I think a smile makes the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: loobie21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of November 2011 for 5 nights with my boyfriend, it was our first time to Berlin and we went mainly to visit the Christmas markets (which were amazing!!). We booked the flights and hotel through easyjet and I thought it was fantastic value for what we got. The location of the hotel is excellent, turn right out of the hotel and you are a 5 min walk from the KaDaWe shopping centre and all the shops, restaurants etc and there was also a lovely Christmas market just a bit further down the road from the KaDaWe (in November.) It's also not far at all from the Berlin Zoo, we visited the zoo on one of the days and it was a great day out. You are also right by the UBahn so it's very easy to explore other parts of the city from this hotel. We did use the UBahn a couple of times to visit some of the larger Christmas markets and it was easy enough and not very expensive. We did a hop on hop off bus tour on one of the days, these stop just outside the KaDaWe and you can buy tickets on the bus and they cover all the main sights and are a good price for a 48 hour ticket. The rooms were very nice, spacious and clean and the beds were very comfy. The shower/bathroom is a bit of an odd design there is basically no door on the bathroom and the shower has a glass door so could be a bit awkward depending who you are staying in the room with!! A good thing is though if someone is in the shower you can still get to the toilet/mirror. The staff were helpful and friendly, the breakfast was AMAZING so much choice and was just delicious. I absolutely loved Berlin and I would definitely stay here again if I were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geezpeace
Reviews.Content: Just about everything I would say about this hotel has been said in other reviews, but it all definitely bears saying again. We've stayed in hotels in London, New York, Paris, Rome and many other European cities, and the Ivbergs stands out as one of, if not THE, best. The staff, the room, the restaurant, the location - all nigh on perfect. The breakfast was sublime and I have never tasted a better burger and chips than the one we had from room service (and it was only 8.50 euros). If and when we return to Berlin we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for sightseeing in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: raeofbonnybanks
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless, firm beds with crisp white linen. Lovely shower room with towels changed daily if you want. Very good breakfast with a huge selection of cereals, yoghurts, breads. There was a good selection of continental meats and cheeses. Hot breakfast of bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs. ( I would have liked a fried egg but this was unavailable - the only complaint and it is a small one really). The service in the breakfast room was great. The reception staff were very helpful especially the guy with the auburn hair! It was very easy to get anywhere in Berlin from this location, by bus or u bahn. To get to the hotel you can take the airport express from Schonefeld airport to the Zoologischer Garten, then one stop on the u bahn to Wittenberg Pl. There is a Lidl store 2 mins walk away and a very reasonably priced and good Italian restaurant opposite!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chippy098
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. breakfasts were fabulous, rooms comfortable and clean. The hotel is in a very convenient position

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chilli_stu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend last week. Lovely hotel and helpful staff. There are no leisure facilities but to be honest, I don't want to spend money to sit in the hotel all day. I want to explore Berlin! The room was comfortable and clean. I managed to resist the temptation of the mini bar. Great bar for cocktails. Many thanks to the ginger-haired receptionisnt we dubbed Justin Gingerlake, for his fab restaurant recommendations. Worth the price alone for the amazing breakfasts. Wow, such choice.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT NOT 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: babykerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in October. It is a comfortable hotel in a good location close to main shopping centre. It is listed as 4 star but compared to UK hotels I would rate it a 3 star. Like most places in Berlin the building is very grey. The hotel has no leisure facilities. There is a small bar and a restaurant open in evenings but not very inviting. Did not try either. We booked room only. Breakfast was a ridiculous 15 euro and this was for continental breakfast. There are numerous cafes and restaurants nearby including a cafe just outside where you can get a much cheaper meal. The rooms are nice but beds very hard. No TV/ Coffee facilities but this is common in Germany. There is a mini bar in room which is very expensive. There is a Lidl supermarket just outside and Kaiser supermarket nearby where you can get a bottle of vodka for £4.25 and a large beer for 23p. Berlin itself is agreat place to visit. The Germans are very friendly people nothing like you would imagine from what you here when in Spain etc. There are bars cafes and restaurants galore.Prices in bars and restaurants same or cheaper than UK and you can drink round the clock. Everywhere is licenced including cafes and bakers. If you are looking for a quiet day or late night drink pop into a cafe or bakers where you will get a large beer for 1.50 euro and a small bottle of vodka etc with 5 UK measures for about 2 euro. All in all a nice hotel in a great city and recommended for a break that will suit anyone. One thing to watch out for however if you are not broad minded. The hotel is across the road from the gay quarter where every building is a gay bar, restaurant, pizza place, massage parlour etc and nearby is red light area but do not be put off. This is a broad minded city and you will not get any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for city break”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights 4 to 7 January 2012 and can thoroughly recommend it; I travelled with family and friends for my mum's 60th birthday and we all loved our stay. The hotel is in between Nollendorfplatz and Wittenbergplatz U-bahn stations but we always used Nollendfordplatz, getting about is quite straightforward and fairly cheap. We considered buying the 3 day pass but in the end paid for daily tickets; a day group ticket for up to 5 adults was 15 euros, and covered A and B zones. The breakfast is as good as everybody says and fills you up for the day and is served til 10.30am which is a bonus! The shower is AMAZING and I could have stayed in it all day. As I shared a room with my mum the glass shower door was fine but it is a little revealing if sharing with friends. I booked the trip through Easyjet holiays and we paid £139 each with one suitcase between the 4 of us; we had researched the cost of getting from the airport to the hotel by train, and I also emailed the hotel for a rough quote for a taxi; they replied with a figure of 40-50 euros. When we arrived we simply gave the address to a driver of one of the many taxis outside, and he quoted between 30-35 euros so we decided to take it; it ended up being 32euros which between 4 of us was fine. The hotel also does an airport shuttle run which is advertised at the reception but this is 40 euros for up to 4 people and a bit more for 5+. The hotel is a few minutes from the KaDeWe department store and a realllllly long street full of shops including many well known ones. We ate at San Marco Italian over the road on the first night and it was really nice food and unbelievably dirt cheap. We also ate in the hotel one night and although the menu isn't massive it was another nice meal at a reasonable cost, for a hotel.Our most expensive meal was at a Mexican on or near Potsdamer Platz (think it was called Cancun) and funnily enough was also our least favourite! If you want to see the Brandenburg Gate then it's probably best getting the U-bahn to Potsdamer Platz and walking five mins or so from there - there is a U-bahn station at the Gate but the line is only covered by a shuttle train which just goes back and forth between this stop and 2 others so it's a bit fiddly trying to get there as you can only get the shuttle from a couple of stations. All in all I had a fantastic trip; the only negative for me was that my room was a smoking room and I could tell from the smell as soon as I entered the room. My sister's room was the same and ashtrays and matches were provided in both rooms; I'm not 100% sure but I think every room is smoking, as I wasn't given the option of non smoking when I booked it. The hotel apparently had a refurb in 2009 so the smell wasn't overpowering but whether it would be in a few years time....? Oh and my tea addict mum did miss having a kettle in the room but apart from that everything was fabulous and I want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, great location. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyunison
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a last minute package city break... It was unbelievably cheap although I'm delighted to say that it lived up to all the other reviews. The location is great; right between two u-bahn stops on the main U1 and U2 lines. These run all night at the weekend, with the U1 taking you between the Kreuzburg and Charlottenburg districts in a few minutes. The room was comfortable, quiet and very clean. The breakfast was outstanding; one of the best I've had in a European hotel. Huge selection and good quality, served until 10:30. The staff were very polite and well presented. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone regardless of price, however the fact that it can be booked for such great prices on line make it a no brainer. I've stayed in absolute holes for twice the price in Amsterdam, Paris etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and yummy breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: kelabel
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for several days when we visted Berlin. We booked this hotel fairly last minute and got on an offer which included breakfast there too. The room was a good size, clean and comfy. It had a TV in the room and a small mini fridge. The bathroom in the room was good too. The toilet and shower had seperate doors with the sink inbetween. We liked this as it meant one of us could shower while the other could use the sink/toilet/mirror if they needed to. It also had air con in our room. The breakfast buffet was great. You could have a choice of cold meats, cheese, bread, smoked salmon, hot foods such as bacon, eggs etc and cereals, toast, fruit, jam and small pastries. There was great choice for everyone. You could fill yourself up for your day sightseeing. The hotel was also really near a Lidl supermarket where you could stock up on snacks/ drink for your trip if needed. It was also walking distance to 2 stations which was very handy. The staff were all really helpful and friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: buiumb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between two metro stations Excellent service Innovative and clean rooms Fair price There is no landscape in the back rooms - they turn to the garage Free Wi-Fi

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay.”
Reviews.Author: tomersi
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the hotel between the dates of 29.12.2011 to 01.01.2012 The Hotel location is excellent. Between two major metro stations and within walking distance of 3 minutes from the center of Berlin. Large rooms, clean and well equipped. Nice hotel staff courteous and helpful. We will definitely go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helped create a memorable weekend”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: First trip to Berlin, and had a wonderful experience from start to finish. From airport to Zoological train station ,3Euros, from train station to nearest u bahn even less then 2 min walk to our fantastic hotel. Booked at last minute for next to nothing (£80 for two nights B & B) at it was stunning. Great rooms and i could have stayed in the showers for ever,lol. Huge selection for breakfast and found that the hotel is handily placed, not far from 2 u bahn stations and well within walking distance of the KDW department store where incidently we picked up the Red bus tour for 20 euros which was a hop on hop off tour of Berlin, excellent. Nice little friendly italian restaurant just up from hotel and Hard Rock cafe was only a short walk away. A great stay and would return, just one thing, the little bespeckled barman in the hotel did seem to take a dislike to me and to my feeble attempts to speak german but hey ho ( and i tipped him!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location”
Reviews.Author: tuffpuff
Reviews.Content: Close to the Schöneberg scene and the shops (including KDW) it is very well located. Rooms are clean and comfortable if a bit small. Breakfast is served until 10:30 and has a great choice. Internet free is but connectivity is erratic; sort that out and I would probably give 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: VAL-ENCIENNES
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a short breaks package at an outrageously cheap price, partly based on previous good reviews. We could not have done better. The hotel is modern and clean and ideally located a few minutes walk from the Kurfurstendam and 2 underground stations with easy links to all parts of the city. A Lidl supermarket is next door and there are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. Breakfast was copious with a wide choice of hot and cold dishes. The room was large, especially for a European capital. The only downside - I would agree with previous reviews about the design of the bathroom; it's not ideal even if you are travelling with your partner and I didn't like it at all. On the other hand, my partner really liked it as she could get her makeup on while I was in the shower, so it's horses for courses. If you were travelling with a friend or relative rather than a partner this design would be no good from a privacy aspect. But that's a minor gripe. Overall, this is an excellent hotel. It's not one to stay in if you want a hotel full of character, because it's featureless, but for cleanliness, value, location and breakfast it's first class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very high standards, excellent staff and AMAZING breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Hananski
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough. I was not expecting much as we paid very little for the entire trip (inlcuding flights) but were amazed at the quality and service this hotel offers, especially for the price! We arrived by U-bahn at Wittenburg Platz and could see the hotel almost as soon as we left the station. It is in an excellent location for getting just about anywhere in Berlin and is about 500m from 2 U-bahn stations. The hotel staff were excellent, very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room was lovely - very clean, lots of space, free wifi, gorgeous big shower and easy temperature control. The breakfasts were delicious and diverse. We had so many options from hot bacon, eggs, sausages etc to cooked cold meats and cheeses,smoked salmon, fruit and yoghurts, cereals, pastries and traditional german breakfast items. You can help yourself and go back and have more of anything you like. It's all beautifully presented, very fresh and very tasty! I would love to visit Berlin again one day and would look forward to staying at the Ivberg Premium again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LE0788
Reviews.Content: The hotel was about a 3 minute walk from an underground station which was on one of the main underground lines. Our hotel room was very spacious and exceptionally clean. Breakfast had a huge selection - hot food, breads, cold meats and cheese, fruit, pastries, yoghurt and juices. Brekafast was also open for about 4 hours so you did not feel you had to rush. The only english speaking channel was BBC News but that was not really a problem as we used the room as a base. All in all a great hotel and ideal for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but the location is not the best for a young couple”
Reviews.Author: Romeisgreat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. It's new, clean and has great food. Close to shopping streets and a major train station. The only problem is when you are a young couple you wish to enjoy Berlin's night life but this hotel is too far from Berlin's night clubs and bars, even if you use the fantastic transportation options you have at night. Other than that, I truly recommend Ivbergs Premium.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Preet84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and found it perfectly adequate for the price. The rooms are small but very clean and the location is very good as it is within walking distance to one of the main subway stations and there are lots of shops nearby aswell. Staff is very friendly and helpful and speak great English. We had breakfast included and it was very nice with a big selection. Ok so criticisms: The television is fairly small (I know this sounds petty but when the bed is really far away from the TV it does make a difference!) The only English channels that are available are a couple of news channels so this was a bit annoying! There is no kettle in the room. No shower caps were provided (which most 4 star hotels have). Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are watching the budget. It is by no means luxurious but it is comfortable and clean which is the most important thing!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sonandwest1
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Hubby for 3 nights, fantastic location, a few minutes from KaDeWe and by main u-bahn line. Hotel was very clean, room small with no tea/coffee facilities but this was the only thing I could find as a negative. the breakfast was plentiful and Would suit a more European cuisine (no full English), but was still hot, fresh and tasty. Very helpful reception staff, gave info re tourist attractions etc. If I go back to Berlin I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobMT
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend in Berlin and I found this hotel to be really really great.So easy to find, get the tube (ticket machines are in English and easy to use,remember to stamp it in the next machine) to Wittenburg platz and leave the station walking straight ahead a few hundred yards.You can aslo get the tube to Nollendorf Platz its the same distance(there are lots and lots of great restaurants here too).The staff are so friendly, all wanting to use their English on you. The rooms are very clean and modern with deviding shower/sink/toilet..all you need really. Breakfast is amazing, all the comments here are correct. Fresh, plentifull healthy breakfast. Lots and lots of fruit, German sausages, cerials,breads,croisants,pain uh chocolate ect. just wonderful for a busy day sight seeing.I will defanaitly be back here and recommend to all.A great city break hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicknRuth
Reviews.Content: The Ivbergs Premium is located between Wittenbergplatz and Nollendorfplatz underground stops - we always got off at the first one which is only a five minute walk away. (This is also the stop for Ka De We) The staff on reception and at breakfast were friendly and helpful. The room is a standard hotel room size and the bathroom does have a strange layout of toilet with sliding door, open view sink alongside this and a shower with glass door on the other side, so anyone using the shower is totally visible to anyone who wishes to use the sink or toilet at the same time, which may be an issue for some but didn't worry us – if you were in an enclosed bathroom a second person wouldn’t be able to use these facilities anyway. One bad point was the hairdryer - 3 settings but only 1 output and it was pretty rubbish which was a real problem. I couldn't leave my hair wet as it was so cold outside but it took such a long time to dry. The breakfast buffet was also very good with plenty to choose from – although I’m still not sure about pancakes and apple strudel with soft cheese as an ingredient. All in all for what we paid for the room for 5 nights we got an amazing deal and I would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MatildaM01
Reviews.Content: ggmon76 has just written my review for me. We stayed from 16th to 19th November and I agree entirely with his/her review. The best buffet breakfast we have ever had. Directions to the hotel are spot on. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We bought a 72 hour pass for public transport at the airport which cost 24.90 euros. This lasted for our entire visit including return to the airport. Excellent value, ant the transport system is so efficient. Trip on local bus no 100 or 200 from the Zoo is excellent to get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ggmon76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a city break. Excellent location - easy walk to underground stations, restaurants and shops. Staff very efficient and helpful, we were checked in when we arrived at 10.30am with no problem. Rooms were comfortable, not huge but big enough, good shower, free safe, very little noise from the corridors. Rooms are unbelievably hot - we left the window open the whole time we were there. If you can get a B and B deal then take it, the breakfast is great - the best i have had in a european city hotel. The attached restaurant is very nice - pasta dishes in the region of 6 to 8 Euros. If i had to find some negatives then road facing rooms do suffer from heavy traffic noise, and there is very little by way of comp toiletries. If we return to Berlin i wouldnt hesitate to book here again. A few things to note - Kaiser-Wilhelm Tower ruins are being restored and are completely covered up - looks like an office block, took me a while of walking around in circles to figure out why i couldnt see it. The U bahn is excellent for getting about and cheap but can be confusing on the first couple of goes as different lines share the same tracks - at the moment there is also a lot of work going on and some lines arent running as normal - a lot of trains terminating at Wittenbergplatz and Gleisdreieck - you have to change to carry on to further stops. Easiest way from Shonefeld airport to hotel is Airport express to Zoo Garten then U Bahn to Nollendorfplatz (3 Euros) - this U stop is much easier access to hotel that Wittenbergplatz. You will come up on a huge crossroads but as an earlier post says just look for Lidl and head in that direction and you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: karen r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights on our first trip to Berlin. The hotel was very well situated close to underground stations, bars, shops and restaurants. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. The rooms were clean and the layout was absolutely fine for us as a couple but may not be suitable for friends or relatives sharing due to the open plan nature of the bathroom. We found it easy to connect to the WiFi at reception and were lucky to continue receiving quite a good signal in our room. We would not hesitate to stay at the hotel in the future as we do plan to visit Berlin again. We did not dine in the hotel as there is a huge choice of restaurants within walking distance and many more a short bus or underground ride away. We did eat at the italian directly across from the hotel one night due to the heavy rain and it was okay but very good value. You must make a point of visiting KaDeWe and especially the food hall which is amazing. I can also recommend the city sight seeing bus tours which were were very informative and ran to time. If you plan to visit the Reichstag building, please ensure that you register online a few days before you plan to go or you will not gain access.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: emma_yates
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modren and clean, the breakfast was brilliant could not fault that and staff were friendly, the hotel is located near shops if your a keen shopper this is the hotel to be. My only fault with this hotel was the set out, I was staying here with my mother and the set out of the bathroom was rather strange the bathroom was very open there was no door to one side there was a toilet with a door and on the other side the shower with a screen but where the sink was was open which meant when getting out of the shower you could possible be seen by the other person in the room, I think my room would be recommened for couples rather than other family memebers travelling together or work colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but soulless”
Reviews.Author: PukkaSahib
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located for exploring the shopping and nightlife in Schöneberg. The reception area is small and can be rather crowded as the hotel seems to attract large tour groups. The room was not very large either. It was clean and comfortable, but it was simply efficient, not trying to convey any charm or luxury. Breakfast was a large and varied buffet. And most of it was really fresh and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FJWhittle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern and the room (and bathroom) large and well equipped. There was maid service each day and the rooms were very clean. It is well located between two underground stations and is within walking distance of the Bauhaus, Zoo, KaDeWe and the Teatre Gardens. The breakfast was excellent with lots of hot food and plenty of choice. It is pretty far west of the centre at Potsdamer Platz to return there each evening so we ate at the hotel restaurant a few nights which was good. Cocktails at the bar were cheap. The staff were really nice and helpful and spoke really good English.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: StHelensJan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Best things- right by 2 underground stations and walking distance to Zoologischer station if you feel like a brisk walk There was plenty of choice for Breakfast- so we filled up for the day Rooms were clean and bathroom area very smart San Marco Italian restaurant across road very good (open til 1am so if you arrive late like we did- 3 hours delay, thanks Easyjet- you can get a good meal Europa centre and KaDeWe store close by Drawbacks- miserable male on reception for our arrival- so rude! (but rest of staff very nice) No real atmosphere Berlin itself was great- a bit tricky to negociate the rail systems at first but very reliable. Buy a Welcome Berlin ticket 25 Euro at airport- for all travel aropund Berlin and to and from airport. We went on Walking tour with Brewers- Thanks Matt! and sightseeing bus following day to give our sore feet a rest. A great city, with lots of history.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient, but rather characterless”
Reviews.Author: Kule Dude
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend (Saturday to Tuesday) October 2011. With Tegel airport being so near to the city centre, it was an easy and economic taxi ride to the hotel. Rooms are reasonable size, clean and smart. Separate WC, washing area and shower room - the shower was excellent, with high and low level shower heads. Reasonable sized desk area and flat screen TV with a variety of intrnational channels. Staff friendly and very helpful. As detailed on the website, there are two, free to use, internet enabled computers in the reception area, as well as a bar area and restaurant, with limited menu. The breakfast room and its offerings was excellent. Plenty of staff clearing used plates and dishes. The selectio0n of items ranged from breads, through to a full cooked selection of eggs, bacon, sausage etc as well as cold meats and cheeses, smoked salmon and fruit. All on a serve yourself basis - which really set us up for the day. I would quite happily recommend this hotel for both business and lesiure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: noamIL
Reviews.Content: Good location with close proximity to two underground stations making getting around the city very easy (bus line 100 station at the corner of Bayreuther Straße and Kurfürstenstraße) Room small although clean. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel. Free Internet with cable in the room (wifi @ loby) located in the gay area feel very safe anytime of the day. Buffet breakfast with loads of choices but a bit pricey 15 euros per person. Many restaurants and cafes just a few steps from nollendorf platz station on Maaßenstraße. we didn't like the Clear glass shower door could be nice if the door was frosted glass. Flat screen tv is only 23" a bit small for a room. Air condishing can not be turn Off only fan & temperature can be adjusted. Free internet is great but could be nice to have wifi instead of cable in the room

Reviews.Title: “Worthy...”
Reviews.Author: NatheWellington
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to German, I felt very comfortable at Ivbergs Premium. The staff members are very kind and generous people. The rooms are nice, quiet and private. I was on an individual trip to explore Germany and I hoped to experience the day to day life beyond the normal tourist attractions. I also wanted to socialize and get involved with German people. I enjoyed the food well..

Reviews.Title: “Read it and please be aware”
Reviews.Author: russell l
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern, Please note that my girlfriend and I arrived to the hotel and we have a lot to tell about the stuff of the hotel. The service is disgraceful. The stuff are talking and mocking in German in the guest faces! It is humiliating. Thay are yelling and behaving terrible. If you have any request or issue thay act and ignore. There are something good to. The room is very clean. The brackfact is great and variety. Please keep in mind this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - shame about the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: PennyH2009
Reviews.Content: Everything that has been written about the location of this hotel is correct. Good location with close proximity to two underground stations making getting around the city very easy. If you are coming from Tegel airport take the X19 bus from the airport to Zoologischer Garten then one stop on the underground to Wittenberg Platz. It is only a short walk to the hotel from there. At a cost of 2.30 euros per person, much cheaper than a taxi at 20 euros plus tip. Room small although clean. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel on the 6th floor. None of the rooms in the hotel apparently have a bath, even though the hotel's website indicates that they do. Whilst that may not be important to some people, a soak in the bath after a day walking around a city may be important (it certainly was for us) so beware. Wonderful buffet breakfast with loads of choice. Whilst we did not eat in the hotel's restaurant as it looked rather clinical, we would thoroughly recommend a small Italian restaurant - Il Valentino at Kurfurstenstrabe 56 (a road running parallel to and behind the hotel and about a 7-8 minute walk), friendly service and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great. New, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: alfalove
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a last minute deal and I found an extremely cheap rate. I was a bit worried as I know that nobody gives you something for little money. I anyway decided to go there as it was close to a metro station and close to where I had to go. The hotel is extremely comfortable, few minutes from the metro stop and very close to the KaDeWe as well as the Schoneberg area. Although on a street with quite some traffic, the rooms are very quiet. It gives the impression of being very new, immaculate clean, with good service. The rooms are a bit small with an open bathroom so if you're travelling in a couple make sure that this is not a problem for you. Breakfast is abundant with many choices to satisfy different needs. The WiFi is free and available throughout the hotel, although in my room, on the 2nd floor, I had often problems with the strength of the signal.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was nice, the staff was nice.”
Reviews.Author: Tanto4
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice, the staff was nice. We were friendly welcomed by the man at the desk, but his jacket was really dirty (also the next night). The room itself was nice and big. Silent too which, together with the comfortable beds, made a good nights sleep. The choice for breakfast was enormous and the fresh fruit was really good. Wifi in room was lacking, there was a cable connection for internet but is useless while using a mobile phone. The location is very nice, near the KaDeWe and 2 large metrostations. Razorblades were available upon request. And there was no water boiler in the room. The Hotel and Staff are nice, but what you get for the price is rather low.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mitch088
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a 3 night stay at the Ivbergs Premium. All the reviews were exactly right this is a lovely hotel in a great location right next to the nollendarplatz train station and not far from Zoo Graten which has all the main shopping streets and the europa centre. there was a large variety of food for breakfast which was all lovely, however breakfast is 15euro and if you are not as fortunate as ourselves to get it included i think it is quite expensive, however saying that you could take as much as you wanted which done us until our evening meal. I would recommend a place called Amait in the nollenderplatz area close to the hotel. Its a indian restaurant, the food was amazing and their was not shortage of it for a very cheap price. we also sat outside to eat which was lovely as it was so hot. I would also recommend the restaurants near zoo graten. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel or a trip to berlin as both were amazing and we shall no doubt return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.....”
Reviews.Author: boro65
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 3 night break at this superb hotel. Believe all the good reviews you read as we can vouch that it's a truly stylish hotel with hardly a fault. Room was at the back and very quiet in the morns. The breakfast was amazing!! So much choice. The location is brilliant. The staff were helpful and spoke good english ( I don't think there's a language barrier in Berlin! ). Had a couple of meals in the restaurant and can honestly say they were as delicious and well cooked as I have had in a long time. Overall, a fantastic hotel, and at the price and location.....we're gonna look nowhere else for a hotel in western Berlin on our return! Great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ortal1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, very clean and organized. the crew in the hotel are very very nice and gentle! the breakfast was varied and fresh. the location of the hotel is great! just 400 meter from the train station (Witten-berg platz), and 3 minutes walk from 100 bus line (recommended). Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kimbaroni
Reviews.Content: We do a *lot* of European travel, and have stayed in many lovely hotels. This hotel is my current favorite. Why? 1. The rooms: they're immaculately clean, the beds are wicked comfortable, and the showers are excellent. Also - well-functioning air conditioning! 2. Free internet access that WORKS. 3. *Amazing* breakfast that easily serves as a satisfying lunch a well - effectively two meals in one. 4. Very friendly staff. 5. Great location, close to public transportation. 6. There's even a good restaurant at the hotel if you're feeling tired and/or unadventurous and need a night in. And the prices are completely reasonable. 7. Luggage storage. Man, is that key with the weird flight schedules we seem to get. I recommend this hotel unreservedly; I'd give it 6 stars if I could. I'll stay there every time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireShrews
Reviews.Content: An ideal hotel for a comfortable city break. The hotel was contemporary and clean, staff were smart and very helpful and the breakfasts were excellent. Our room was at the rear, well appointed and quiet. The hotel is located a short walk from a U Bahn station with three lines and is only 10 mins walk from the Zoo Garten, 5 mins walk to KDV. We found some good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, the best we thought was an Italian - Trattoria a Muntagnola in Fuggerstrasse (www.muntagnola.de). Overall a great hotel which we have recommended to friends and will hopefully visit again

Reviews.Title: “good location, strange rooms”
Reviews.Author: RIKMP
Reviews.Content: OK - I booked through Octopus (Gulliver's) at a rate of Euro 37 - far below what the rate on their website was. Although I would have preferred their website, and one would assume they would not let a third party have control over their selling rates, this rate was unbeatable. I signed up for a twin bedded room, but since I was a single traveller I got a single room. Not too bad, but then I also got an accesible room which was a shame as you sort of like a bathtub to enjoy a bath - especially when staying a longer period of time. Great thing on the hotel is the A/C (which is why I chose the hotel - it was the cheapest with A/C). I also had breakfast included - but did not use it so cannot commend on it, but the breakfast place looked nice. Location is unbeatable right in between the Nollendorfplatz and the Wittenbergplatz and bording the gay district with loads of bars and restaurants. There was no change of bedlinnen for 5 nights (like at home :-)) but rooms was nicely made every day. Internet is included but on my floor it is not WIFI and the cable you get from the Front Desk only lets you work at the desk (and not laying on the bed - but perhaps it is only me doing that) with an uncomfortable deskchair. Friendly and professional reception team, the housekeeping lady did not speak German or English but with gestures we managed to share a laugh when I thanked her, which is so much more important. The only recommendation for the hotel would be to never ever allow a third party to undercut your own selling rates as you are loosing out double and to ask if someone minds or does not mind an accesible rooms. Value for money paid was unbeatable though.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: yosint
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel five nights, the hotel is not magnificent but we recommend it strongly because of the excellent location, good rooms and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lsupremo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - modern, clean, comfortable, friendly and efficient - in excellent location for public transport for business and sightseeing, with U-Bahn at Nollendorfplatz and Wittenbergplatz both within 5 mins walk. Spotless modern rooms, comfortable bed, fabulous walk-in shower, room safe, good fast internet access (not wifi, but can get loan of network cable from reception). Free wifi in public areas downstairs, but If you don't have your laptop with you, Ivbergs has a room off reception with 2 PCs, etc. for guest use. And what a wonderful breakfast! Expensive at €15, but we were on an inclusive rate from Roomex.com of less that €40 per night for a double room incl our 2 breakfasts. Hard to beat that! Most unusual to see the waiter wearing a white glove to put out the cutlery. Will definitely stay at Ivbergs Premium again next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Aussienanna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and the choice was perfect. Cheerful and helpful reception staff, excellent breakfast each morning with a good selection of both hot and cold foods. The room was spotless and even though we overlooked the main street, the noise was not a problem. We dined in 3 nights and found the menu varied and tasty enough for our palates. Location was convenient to two stations as well as local bus stops which we used to tour the main city highlights.

Reviews.Title: “modern rooms, fantastic breakfast, great location and and good service”
Reviews.Author: stracrat
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here with a Easyjet Holidays offer. The room was modern with a great shower. The hotel is very close to 2 underground stations and a short walk to many lovely shops and places to eat. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a tasty selection of fruit, cereals, meats, cheese, tea, coffee, breads and salads. We hired bikes and left them in the car park at the back of the hotel overnight. We cycled around the city and really enjoyed this aspect of our holiday. We had 3 days of sun and loved the relaxed atmosphere of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahElizabeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, the staff were super friendly and helpful, and everything was sparkly clean. I couldn't fault the hotel - it's not in the heart of the city but it was so close to the Nollendorfplatz station that this didn't prove to be a problem at all. I'd also recommend the Italian restaurant across the road - brilliant value and a lovely meal. The breakfast at the hotel was also excellent. We loved our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellently situated and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MRW563
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated between 2 U bahn stations (Wittenbergpl & Nollendorfpl) which are approx 5-10 minutes’ walk from the hotel and also the same time from the big store KaWeDe (next to Wittenbergpl). Had a room with double bed and en-suite facilities which were kept very clean and adequate space to move around. Room looked over back and was quiet unless you left window open and you got delivery lorry noise at 6.30am. Breakfast was included in hotel deal and had cereals, cooked selection, continental meat/cheese etc, fruit selection with coffee/tea etc. Good value but at 15 Euros some guests may choose to go elsewhere. Staff spoke good English and no trouble with reservations or booking in. Do not use restaurant but menu appeared to be varied and at reasonable prices. Also available (near main reception) was free internet with computer/printer which made it ideal for scanning for site seeing places and restaurants during stay. Eating places up towards Wittenbergpl but greater choice at Nollendorfpl but as U bahn system is very good the city is your oyster. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: patteebee
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel. It was spotlessly clean, efficiently run and in a good location for travel links all around the city. Breakfast was very good and staff were helpful and efficient. We got a really good deal through easyJet holidays. If I had to name a fault, it was that I couldn't get a wi-fi link in the reception area on my mobile but, apart from that, everything else was spot on. Thank you Ivbergs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Friday-Sunday. The location is very nice as it's close to Wittenbergplatz with KaDeWe and the U-bahn which makes it easy to get around the city fast. The hotel room was OK, with seperate shower and toilet. The room was clean and renovated. The drawback was the key system to open the doors. It was difficult to get the key to work properly as they were sensomatic. We didn't try the hotel breakfast as there are many nice cafes around.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all boxes”
Reviews.Author: cazSheffield
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in handy location and at a very reaonable price. Agree with all former positve reviews that this is a good choice for a city break. It is a brief walk from the underground from where you can reach most important tourist attractions within a few minutes. We especailly enjoyed and have never seen such a wide range of choices. Make sure you book bed and breakfast as breakfast is expensive ( 15 euros) if booked seperately.

Reviews.Title: “Très très bien!”
Reviews.Author: SAPTONO
Reviews.Content: Nice room, confortable beds with simple but very functional bathroom! Big and good breakfast. Free internet in the room. Very friendly staff! Location was a bit outside the centre of Mitte but in the hearth of gay's places! So don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: barrington27
Reviews.Content: What a surprise.Our first trip to Berlin could not have been better.The hotel is in a great location an easy 5 minute walk from the u-bahn.The hotel is a very modern clean friendly hotel with lovely staff from the reception through to the bar and restaurant. The rooms are excellent with lovely shower room. The shops are just an easy stroll 5 minutes from the hotel. Turn left out of the hotel and walk 10 minutes and you have a great selection of bars, restaurants, cafes and bistros, all with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for all Berlin sights.”
Reviews.Author: denn_wanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew to Berlin Shoenfeld airport from Liverpool on 30th Jan 2011 for a three night stay. The Shoenfeld express is the easiest way to travel from that Airport which stops at Oterbahnhof, Alexanderplatz, and a few more stops. The locacation of Hotel Ivberg required us to get off the train at Zoo garten. We then took the line 2 ( red ) to Nollendorfplatz, 2 stops. The Hotel is situated on the opposite side of the road which is a right turn, just past Lidl. The price of the ticket is 3 euros and is valid for 90 mins. A day ticket for zones A and B costs 6 euro 30 and is valid through until 3 am. The Hotel offers a superb breakfast, this was included in our price, it costs 15 euro if it aint included which is a little steep. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable with flat screen TV, free safe and a nice walk in shower. Anyone who complains about this hotel must be hard to please. Turn right from the hotel doors take you to Wittenberplatz, this is where the famous Ka De We store is situated and is Berlins answer to Harrods. Left from the hotel and accross the road at Nollendorf u bahn are many bars and restaurants, al;l of which are not expensive. If you like ke baps, there is a little one called Mocco at the top of the street, there you can sit inside and enjoy a beer. To the right of the kebab place is a themed pub called Slumberland, it`s a carribean bar with a floor covered with sand, this place is a gopod cheap place to chat with locals and tourists alike. There are many other bars down the side streets offering good food and beers. An Italian Restaurant accross the road from the hotel offers a very good menu at reasonable prices, and it is comfortable. I would reccoomend this location because it`s a quiet area and easy to get to all the major attractions Berlin has to offer. It is a very big city and a little bit of homework regarding the s bahn and u bahn prior your trip would be good. Familiarise yourself with the city by reading up on thew web and books because this will serve you well and you will enjoy the vacation more having done so, If your a sports fan, a visit to the olympic stadium is a must. Again, from Nollendorf, line 2 (red) in the direction of ruhleben takes you within 5 mins walk under the low subway. It costs 4 euro to go and look at the staduim and go inside. Well worth a visit. Another trip worth doing and some books do not mention this, if you are looking for a part of the wall that still remains then get to Bernauer strasse. Easiest way is take the u bahn to Alexanderplatz then U9 (blue). Follow the tramlines down the hill and the wall is there. Also there is a memorial with has pictures of those who perished. You can also walk between what once was no mans land. I hope this can be of help.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin at -4C”
Reviews.Author: Kertesz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and can be easily reached by buss or metro.Big rooms and plenty of shelves to put things.Sink is not separated from the room .Mini bar ,safe ,lcd tv and a/c all were well working.Breakfast was excellent and we enjoyed it each morning.The first dining room I saw in a hotel where the waiter wore white gloves when putting the dishes on the table.I was very impressed .No other utilities in the hotel,if not visiting the city you might find yourself bored in the hotel.A few very good restaurants in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: damjanh
Reviews.Content: Words can describe it..its just fantastic hotel. Located on Kurfursterdam, just minutes to metro station. Rooms are spotless, very clean , modern , comfortable. Breakfast for kings ! ( more then rich buffet, from where you can choose almost everything you desire ) The staff is more then helpfull, they have also rent a bike service, which is perfect way to explore Berlin. The hotel in overall deserves 5 stars !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoveCobra
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Rooms were clean and large. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet. Had a room fronting the street and had no noise from street. The breakfast was excellent. Plenty to choose from, something for everyone. The staff were friendly and helpful. Location is pretty good. We took a walking tour, which started at the Zoo Station. That was a 10 minute walk from hotel. Seemed to be a major shopping area on the way. At Zoo station there were buses and trains. They take you to tourist areas in a few minutes. Only problem we had was with internet connection in room. Berlin is a great city and we found this to be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “like, like, like”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Located next to the Ka-De-We and the Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn station, this 4* hotel is the best hotel i have been to in Europe. New, modern, clean, large rooms, helpfull staff, great breakfast, free wifi (in the lobby) and a feeling of a 5* hotel. The proximity to a central train station make your trip much more easier, and the proximity to the Ka-De-We and the Kudamm street make it perfect for shopping springs.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HolidayForUs
Reviews.Content: Our room on the second floor overlooked a small car park and was very quiet, clean and quite spacious with a couple of pictures on the walls. The breakfast was very good, lots of variety, served 6.30-10.30; if it is not included in your room rate it costs 15 euros per person. Staff were helpful. The LAN internet wasn’t working (hence 4-star rating rather than 5-star) so we had to use the wifi in the lobby, which was quick, 54 mbps. Toiletries provided were soap, shower gel and shampoo (and cotton wool) but no body lotion. There were tissues, a shoe horn and a mini sewing-kit in a drawer. The information card said no food or drink to be brought in to your room! Housekeeping was done daily, we stayed 4 nights, but it was slightly irritating that the duvet was turned round and folded into three each day! Corridor lights were motion sensitive. You can buy stamps at reception. It was cheaper to book the room elsewhere online than their own website. With prices available at around £55 a night for a double you can’t go wrong. Transport was easy from the hotel, U-bahn as discussed by previous reviewers and also the buses. The M19 bus stops every ten minutes (at 03,13, 23, etc.) very close to the hotel’s entrance: turn right as you leave the hotel, and it is on the same side of the street after about fifty paces. This is convenient to get to the Europa Centre and stops at Kurfurstendam after this, which is only 3 minutes walk from the 100 bus terminus at the Zoologischer Garten so it saves a bit of walking compared with getting to the U-bahn. The number 100 bus (every ten minutes) passes many of the tourist attractions. You can also catch the 100 bus by crossing the plaza at the Europa Centre stop. Also from the hotel, turn right round the corner outside the Utopia building, and you can catch the M29 bus (every five minutes), transferring to bus 100 after two stops at Lutzowplatz (this is the quickest way to catch bus 100). Hotel car parking is 10 euros per day. There is a small minimarket at the Zoo station shops; no convenience stores by the hotel, only Lidl close by to the left which opens 8-8 Monday to Saturday or instead a little further to the right is Kaiser’s open 7-10 Monday to Saturday, just beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LuDwig82
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in August. I hear the hotel has recently opened and everything is brand new. Stayed in a room on the 6th floor, it was just perfect: spacious, modern, cozy, big shower, no bathtub (for me is a plus). A few steps away from the Nollendorf U-bahn station (5 minutes from Potsdamer Platz and 10 to StadtMitte), right in the heart of Schoneberg and walking distance to KaDeWe (shopaholics will love that. The staff is professional and very very nice. We travelled with our dog and he had been welcomed too (extra charge apply, € 15,00 per night). WiFi free of charge but only in the lobby / computer room (this may change in time). If flying to/from Tegel a taxi ride costs approx € 16 - 20, just great! Last but not least: great breakfast, try to get a tariff with breakfast included, it will be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I will be glad to go back to this hotel (may be not in summer time…)”
Reviews.Author: tomersi
Reviews.Content: Me and another friend stayed at Iveberg hotel from the 30/06/2010 until the 03/07/2010 The hotel is very good located (100 Walk from Nollendorf Station) The staff was very nice and helpful. The room is nice, new and clean. The breakfast was very very good, There was a little problem, when we stay in Berlin the weather Climbed up to 35 Degrees C! and the air condition in the room was a little bit week (it didn't keep us up, but some Guests suffered ) I will be glad to go back to this hotel (may be not in summer time…)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but basic”
Reviews.Author: kezbar30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Feb 2010, Hotel is new and very clean and tidy. Rooms are good with great rain shower. Breakfast was very good. Location is great and you can walk to most attractions from the hotel. This hotel reminded me of a UK Premier Inn type standard, not as classy as other Berlin hotels i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: donna_anka
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its cheap price (there was an event in Berlin and all the hotels around raised up their prices but this one did not). rooms were quite clean, beds were very comfortable. Location is average: the hotel in a short walk from Zoo station from which you quickly can get to airport and city center, but the street where the hotel is located is not very quiet. There're a lot of shops around, but we did not need any shops. I can't say there was something really special, but also I can't say something that disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: Anskula
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite new and it has all the basic things you need. Safety deposit box in the room would have been nice but they had safety with the reception. Room and the breakfast area was a little bare but comfortable. Breakfast was sumptious in the European scale. Juices were fresh and they had lot of fresh fruits too. Bacon was not crispy. The location was good. Shopping areas were close and the hotel was close to 2 metro stations. The bus X9 from the airport (2,10 euros) takes you to Zoologische garden (15-20 min) and from there you can walk to the hotel in a about 15 minutes with a small cabin bag.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeSligo_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Recently visited this hotel during the xmas holidays, it was difficult enough to find coming from Schoenfeld airport, had to get train to Alexanderplatz and then U bahn to Nollenderplatz (5 minute walk from hotel), about an hour commute from airport!! Once we got to the hotel we realised it was in a good location, only less than 5 minute walk from KaDeWe and other shopping streets, also the City Circle sightseeing bus was very close by! There is also lots of nice restaurants within walking distance! The hotel itself was nice, it is very new and clean but lacked any type of character and was very quiet with no atmosphere! staff were friendly and helpful!! rooms were small but had everything needed, shower was great, very big and powerful!! but bathrooms were not very private and there were very few tolieteries supplied especially for a 4 star! Breakfast was good and there was a good choice! Overall I would reccommend this hotel as the location is good, and it was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Schöneberg area”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 days in December (room 259). Hotel is located in Schöneberg area and very close to shopping streets and public transport. Hotel is very new and comfortable. Hotel parking was still under construction, but we could park our car at the back of the hotel (for free). High speed internet is for free and available in hotel lobby (wireless) or in room with data cable (5 euro deposit at reception). Likes: nice rooms, very good rain shower, free internet, good location Dislikes: Hotel could use some additional interior decoration (it would make it a lot more cosier)

HotelInfo.Name: Ivbergs Premium
HotelInfo.Address: Kleiststrasse. 9-12 | Schöneberg, 10787 Berlin, Germany
